books.author: Harper Lee
books.review: A masterpiece of American literature, tackling themes of racial injustice and moral growth in the American South.

books.author: George Orwell
books.review: A dystopian novel that has remained profoundly influential, exploring themes of totalitarianism, surveillance, and individual freedom.

books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.review: A quintessential American novel, capturing the essence of the Jazz Age and exploring themes of love, wealth, and the American Dream.

books.author: Jane Austen
books.review: A beloved classic of English literature, known for its witty social commentary and timeless romance.

books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.review: A classic novel of adolescent angst and rebellion, resonating with generations of readers for its candid portrayal of teenage alienation.

books.author: Herman Melville
books.review: An epic tale of obsession and revenge set against the backdrop of the whaling industry, exploring themes of fate, madness, and the human condition.
